column4: Hey I need to recover a bunch of files that turned into one index.dat file. can anyone help me?
Can anyone help me figure out how to extrack files that turned into a .dat file????
can you not just do the same again? Copy the unreadable-for-XP files with Ubuntu?
from there, did you copy the data to a different location on the same disk?
I think you should try copying the inaccessible data to a different filesystem, like a USB stick.
it's probably safe to say that you can't trust your Windows partition to hold data any more.
no, forget the index file. Get at the source files with Ubuntu again.
have you got 90GB free on your Ubuntu partition(s)?
if you value that data at all, I would turn the computer off now, find a separate hard disk with 90GB free, and copy everything over to that one using the live CD.
that's not what you said earlier...
plenty of people here for me to support who don't run off to do something else.
your problem is a Windows one. Ask in an appropriate channel.
Windows clumped your files together into a single one. How is that not a Windows problem?
